author: Special Correspondent
text:
If you think you can take on the best of the brains, its time for you to take up one of the hardest tests.

Yes, the 16th edition of The Hindu Young World Quiz 2016 is back on Monday.

With 215 teams already registered themselves online for the prestigious event, nothing can stop you from taking part. For, the organisers have allowed on the spot registration for the quiz, held in association with VIT University, at the venue.

Interested students can turn up at Thiyagarajar College at Teppakulam here for the on-the-spot registration.

The quiz, which will be a team event with two members per team, is open for school students studying from Classes 4 to 9.

The competition for juniors category (Class 4 to Class 6) will be held at 10 a.m. while for the seniors (Class 7 to Class 9), it will be at 2 p.m. The registration fee will be Rs.200 per team.

Students taking part in the quiz will have to appear for written preliminary test based on which the top six teams will be selected for the on-stage final.

Exciting prizes are up for grabs in the quiz competition, organised in collaboration with Firefox, Kokuyo Camlin, Ars-HTA and Me Too Snacks, Tirunelveli.

Chief Education Officer, Madurai, J. Angello Irudayasamy, who is the chief guest, would distribute the prizes to the winners.

For further details, contact S.R. Prasath over 9585506050 or 04522528497.
title: The Hindu Young World Quiz today
